title: Integrated management of citrus leafminer in the nursery
reasoning: The abstract compares several treatments including chlorpyrifos and alternatives such as sanitation alone and sanitation combined with Spinosad. It states that sanitation alone or combined with Spinosad harmed the beneficial ladybird beetle less than other treatments, implying a safety advantage. title: Toxicity of nine insecticides on four natural enemies of Spodoptera exigua
reasoning: The abstract compares the toxicity and risk duration of several insecticides including chlorpyrifos. It states that chlorpyrifos showed dangerously toxic and long risk duration on certain natural enemies, while emamectin benzoate, spinosad, and chlorantraniliprole showed no toxicity or higher safety with shorter risk durations. This indicates these substances have safety advantages over chlorpyrifos and can be reasonably interpreted as safer alternatives.

title: The Impact of Pesticide Residues on Soil Health for Sustainable Vegetable Production in Arid Areas
reasoning: The abstract mentions that Chlorpyrifos and Chlorpyrifos-methyl require policy guidelines to limit their use to ensure sustainability, implying concerns about their safety. It also lists several other pesticides (e.g., Bromoxynil, Pendimetholin, Diclofop-methyl, Resmethrin, Methidathion, Ethoprophos, etc.) that can be used safely to maintain sustainable soils and water resources. This suggests these substances are presented as safer alternatives to Chlorpyrifos in this context.
alternatives: Bromoxynil; Pendimetholin; Diclofop-methyl; Resmethrin; Methidathion; Ethoprophos
